    • DWR Publication Classification using an LLM

Classify publications using Google's Gemini LLM with an external NSF taxonomy

Source: R/classify_pubs.R
classify_pubs_gemini.Rd

Uses Google's Gemini LLM to classify academic publications according to the National Science Foundation (NSF) fields-of-study classification system. The function accepts a dataframe of publication abstracts and a taxonomy dataframe, uploads the taxonomy to the LLM, and returns hierarchical classifications.

Usage

classify_pubs_gemini(pubs_df, taxonomy_df, model = "gemini-2.0-flash")

Arguments

pubs_df

A dataframe containing publication information. Must include columns 'doi' and 'abstract_text'.

taxonomy_df

A dataframe containing the NSF taxonomy. Must include columns 'first_level', 'second_level', and 'third_level'.

model

Character string specifying which Gemini model to use. Default is "gemini-2.0-flash".

Value

A tibble with the following columns:

doi

Digital Object Identifier of the publication

first_level

NSF first-level classification field

second_level

NSF second-level classification field

third_level

NSF third-level classification field

raw_response

List column containing the complete raw JSON response

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
classifications <- classify_pubs_gemini(
  my_publications,
  taxonomy_df = nsf_sed_taxonomy
)
} # }
